oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter of S. K. P. House to "Missy Molly"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from S. K. P. House, 1st Lt., Co. B and Co. F, 12th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. In the letter he discusses the death of William (reported to be his brother). House conveys that he plans to enlist again. He also writes about the "posession of Clarksville" and states "Johnson gave it up wit out a Struggle." He is likely referring to Albert Sidney Johnston.
